meanings.def: rare and worth a lot of money
examples: The crown was set with precious jewels—diamonds, rubies and emeralds.
The thieves took three pieces of valuable jewellery.
a precious Chinese vase, valued at half a million pounds
precious memories of our time together

meanings.def: valuable or important and not to be wasted
examples: Clean water is a precious commodity in that part of the world.
precious to somebody You are infinitely precious to me.
My family is the most precious thing I have in my life.
They managed to salvage a few precious possessions from the fire.

meanings.def: used to show you are angry that another person thinks something is very important
examples: I didn't touch your precious car!

meanings.def: very formal, exaggerated and not natural in what you say and do
used to emphasize the fact that there is very little of something or that there are very few of something
examples: There's precious little to do in this town.
Precious few people can afford those prices.
